feed.title: Category: Consumption | Jack Baty - the archives

entry.title: The Sad, Beautiful Fact That We're All Going To Miss Almost Everything
entry.content:
Linda Holmes for NPR:

If "well-read" means "not missing anything," then nobody has a chance. If "well-read" means "making a genuine effort to explore thoughtfully," then yes, we can all be well-read. But what we've seen is always going to be a very small cup dipped out of a very big ocean, and turning your back on the ocean to stare into the cup can't change that.

The urge to not miss anything is so strong that I miss important things.
